title: Psalms Chapter 98 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Psalms chapter 98 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Psalms Chapter 98 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Psalms Chapter 98.

questions.question: According to Psalms 98:1, why should we sing a new song unto the LORD?
options: Because He hath done marvellous things
Because He gave the Ten Commandments
questions.correctAnswer: Because He hath done marvellous things
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:1 states that we should sing a new song unto the LORD because He hath done marvellous things.

questions.question: What has the LORD made known according to Psalms 98:2?
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:2 says that the LORD hath made known his salvation.

questions.question: In Psalms 98:3, what has God remembered toward the house of Israel?
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:3 states that God hath remembered his mercy and his truth toward the house of Israel.

questions.question: Who is called to make a joyful noise unto the LORD in Psalms 98:4?
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:4 commands all the earth to make a joyful noise unto the LORD.

questions.question: What instruments are mentioned in Psalms 98:5 for singing unto the LORD?
options: Harp and voice of a psalm
questions.correctAnswer: Harp and voice of a psalm
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:5 instructs to sing unto the LORD with the harp and the voice of a psalm.

questions.question: According to Psalms 98:6, what instruments should make a joyful noise before the LORD, the King?
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:6 calls for trumpets and the sound of cornet to make a joyful noise before the LORD.

questions.question: What does Psalms 98:7 say should roar?
options: The sea and the fulness thereof
questions.correctAnswer: The sea and the fulness thereof
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:7 says, 'Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof.'

questions.question: According to Psalms 98:8, what should clap their hands?
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:8 tells the floods to clap their hands.

questions.question: In Psalms 98:8, what else besides the floods is described as being joyful together?
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:8 states 'let the hills be joyful together.'

questions.question: What reason is given in Psalms 98:9 for the earth to be joyful before the LORD?
options: For he cometh to judge the earth
For he made the heavens and the earth
questions.correctAnswer: For he cometh to judge the earth
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:9 says the earth should be joyful because the LORD cometh to judge the earth.

questions.question: According to Psalms 98:9, with what qualities shall the LORD judge the world?
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:9 states the LORD shall judge the world with righteousness and the people with equity.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 98:4 calls for a quiet and solemn worship.
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:4 commands to 'make a joyful noise' and 'rejoice and sing praise,' not quiet worship.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 98:1 mentions the LORD's right hand and holy arm getting Him the victory.
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:1 clearly states 'his right hand, and his holy arm, hath gotten him the victory.'

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 98:3 says that only the house of Israel has seen the salvation of God.
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:3 states 'all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God' not only Israel.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Psalms 98:5: 'Sing unto the LORD with the ______; with the harp, and the voice of a psalm.'
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:5 says, 'Sing unto the LORD with the harp; with the harp, and the voice of a psalm.' The missing word is 'voice'.

medium.title: Psalms Chapter 98 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Psalms Chapter 98 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a trial and asks you for counsel. Based on Psalms 98, what biblical truth would you share about God's faithfulness?
options: God has done marvellous things and has gotten victory for us
God only helps those who are perfect
We must earn God's favor through works
God is distant and uninvolved in our struggles
questions.correctAnswer: God has done marvellous things and has gotten victory for us
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:1 teaches us that the LORD has done marvelous things and has achieved victory through His right hand and holy arm, reminding us of His faithfulness and power in trials. This is supported by verses 2 and 3 which emphasize God's salvation and mercy.

questions.question: How does Psalms 98 encourage believers to respond in worship to God's salvation?
options: Sing a new song with joy and musical instruments
questions.correctAnswer: Sing a new song with joy and musical instruments
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:1, 5, and 6 instruct us to sing a new song to the LORD with harps, trumpets, and joyful noise, expressing gratitude for His salvation and righteousness.

questions.question: A believer struggles to trust God’s timing for justice. According to Psalms 98, what assurance can you give them?
options: God will judge the earth with righteousness and equity
Justice will never come in this world
We must take justice into our own hands
questions.correctAnswer: God will judge the earth with righteousness and equity
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:9 clearly states that the LORD will come to judge the earth with righteousness and equity, offering assurance that God’s justice is sure and fair.

questions.question: How can Psalms 98 guide a Christian's attitude towards evangelism?
options: Proclaim God’s salvation openly as all the earth has seen it
Keep faith private and avoid sharing it
Only share faith with close family
Wait for others to ask about faith
questions.correctAnswer: Proclaim God’s salvation openly as all the earth has seen it
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:2-3 shows that God has openly revealed His salvation and righteousness to all the earth, encouraging believers to share the Gospel broadly and confidently.

questions.question: What biblical virtue is emphasized by the call to 'make a joyful noise unto the LORD, all the earth' in Psalms 98:4?
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:4 encourages believers to respond to God’s works with joy and gratitude, praising Him openly and exuberantly.

questions.question: A couple is seeking guidance on how to maintain a joyful family worship. What practice from Psalms 98 can you recommend?
options: Sing praises to the LORD with musical instruments and voices
Avoid singing and focus on silent prayer
Only read scripture without worship songs
questions.correctAnswer: Sing praises to the LORD with musical instruments and voices
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:5-6 encourages singing to the LORD with harp, trumpet, and joyful noise, highlighting worship as a joyful, musical expression suitable for family devotion.

questions.question: How does Psalms 98 teach about God’s mercy and truth in our daily relationships?
options: God remembers His mercy and truth toward us, so we should show mercy and truth to others
Mercy and truth are optional virtues
Only God is merciful; we need not be
Truth can be compromised for convenience
questions.correctAnswer: God remembers His mercy and truth toward us, so we should show mercy and truth to others
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:3 highlights God's mercy and truth toward Israel, encouraging believers to reflect these virtues in their relationships.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 98 teaches that all creation, including the sea and hills, should rejoice before the LORD.
questions.explanation: Verses 7 and 8 describe the sea roaring and hills clapping their hands, symbolizing all creation rejoicing before the LORD.

questions.question: True or False: According to Psalms 98, God judges the world with partiality favoring some nations.
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:9 states that God judges the earth with righteousness and equity, indicating impartial and fair judgment.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Psalms 98 calls us to sing a _____ song unto the LORD because He has done marvellous things.
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:1 commands singing a 'new' song to the LORD in response to His marvelous deeds, symbolizing fresh praise and renewed faith.

questions.question: How does Psalms 98 guide Christians in being witnesses to the truth of God's salvation?
options: By openly showing His righteousness and mercy to all nations
By relying on others to evangelize
By focusing solely on personal holiness
questions.correctAnswer: By openly showing His righteousness and mercy to all nations
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:2-3 reveals that God has made His salvation known openly among the nations, encouraging believers to witness openly and confidently.

questions.question: A believer struggling with discouragement in serving others asks how to maintain joy. Based on Psalms 98, what would you advise?
options: Make a joyful noise and rejoice in the LORD’s victory and salvation
questions.correctAnswer: Make a joyful noise and rejoice in the LORD’s victory and salvation
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:4-6 encourages joyful praise and rejoicing in the LORD, which can sustain believers in their service and fellowship.

questions.question: How does Psalms 98 inspire integrity and honesty in daily work and life?
options: God judges with righteousness and equity, encouraging us to act justly
Integrity is optional in difficult times
questions.correctAnswer: God judges with righteousness and equity, encouraging us to act justly
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:9 reminds us that God's judgment is righteous and equitable, motivating believers to live with honesty and fairness.

questions.question: What does Psalms 98 teach about gratitude in personal devotion?
options: We should sing praises and rejoice because God has done marvelous things
Gratitude is only necessary on special occasions
Silent meditation is the only form of gratitude
Gratitude is unnecessary if life is hard
questions.correctAnswer: We should sing praises and rejoice because God has done marvelous things
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:1-6 stresses joyful singing and making a joyful noise as expressions of gratitude for God's marvelous deeds.

questions.question: How can Psalms 98 help believers persevere through trials?
options: By reminding them of God's victory and righteous judgment
By expecting trials to never end
questions.correctAnswer: By reminding them of God's victory and righteous judgment
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:1 and 9 affirm God's victorious power and righteous judgment, encouraging perseverance and trust during trials.

hard.title: Psalms Chapter 98 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Psalms Chapter 98.

questions.question: What is the primary reason given in Psalms 98:1 for singing a new song to the LORD?
options: He hath created the heavens and the earth
He hath delivered Israel from Egypt
He hath given the law on Mount Sinai
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:1 states that we should sing a new song because the LORD has done marvellous things, highlighting His victorious acts.

questions.question: In Psalms 98:2, what has the LORD made known openly in the sight of the heathen?
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly says that the LORD hath made known his salvation and openly showed his righteousness before the heathen.

questions.question: According to Psalms 98:3, who has the LORD remembered his mercy and truth toward?
questions.explanation: The verse clearly states that the LORD remembered his mercy and truth toward the house of Israel.

questions.question: Which instruments are mentioned in Psalms 98:5 as being used to sing unto the LORD?
options: Harp and voice of a psalm
questions.correctAnswer: Harp and voice of a psalm
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:5 commands to sing unto the LORD with the harp and the voice of a psalm, emphasizing musical worship.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'right hand, and his holy arm' in Psalms 98:1 within ancient Near Eastern royal imagery?
options: Symbols of divine power and victory
questions.correctAnswer: Symbols of divine power and victory
questions.explanation: In ancient Near Eastern culture, a king’s right hand and arm symbolized power and victory; Psalms 98:1 uses these to depict God's victorious acts.

questions.question: Psalms 98:4 uses parallelism with the phrases ‘make a joyful noise’ and ‘rejoice, and sing praise.’ What literary device is this an example of?
questions.explanation: The verse repeats related ideas with different words to reinforce the message, which is characteristic of synonymous parallelism common in Hebrew poetry.

questions.question: In Psalms 98:6, what instruments are commanded to make a joyful noise before the LORD?
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly names trumpets and cornet as instruments to proclaim joy before the LORD, highlighting ceremonial worship.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 98:7 calls for the mountains to clap their hands.
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:7 calls for the sea to roar and its fullness, not the mountains to clap hands; the hills clap in the next verse (98:8).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Psalms 98:9 states that the LORD cometh to judge the earth with ______ and equity.
questions.explanation: The verse clearly states the LORD will judge the earth with righteousness and the people with equity.

questions.question: How does Psalms 98:3’s phrase ‘all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God’ foreshadow New Testament themes?
options: It prefigures the global proclamation of salvation through Christ
It predicts the destruction of the nations
It refers only to the historical deliverance of Israel
It anticipates the building of the temple
questions.correctAnswer: It prefigures the global proclamation of salvation through Christ
questions.explanation: The universal scope of salvation mentioned anticipates the New Testament theme where salvation through Jesus Christ is extended to all nations (cf. Acts 1:8).

questions.question: What cultural practice is reflected by the call to ‘make a joyful noise’ in Psalms 98:4?
options: Ancient Israelite communal worship and celebration
questions.correctAnswer: Ancient Israelite communal worship and celebration
questions.explanation: Joyful noise was a typical expression in Israelite worship gatherings, involving singing and instrumental music as communal praise.

questions.question: Psalms 98:8 says ‘Let the floods clap their hands.’ What is the most likely literary device used here?
questions.explanation: The floods clapping hands attributes human action to natural elements, a common personification in Hebrew poetry to express joy.

questions.question: Which Old Testament book contains a similar call for all creation to rejoice as seen in Psalms 98?
questions.explanation: Isaiah often features calls for creation to rejoice (e.g., Isaiah 44:23), paralleling Psalms 98’s universal praise theme.

questions.question: The phrase ‘he cometh to judge the earth’ in Psalms 98:9 most directly foreshadows which New Testament concept?
options: The second coming of Christ as Judge
questions.correctAnswer: The second coming of Christ as Judge
questions.explanation: This verse anticipates the eschatological role of Christ judging the earth with righteousness, a key New Testament theme (cf. Revelation 19:11-16).

questions.question: Which aspect of divine character is emphasized throughout Psalms 98, linking mercy, truth, and righteousness?
questions.explanation: The Psalm highlights mercy, truth, and righteousness, demonstrating God’s faithfulness and just rule over the earth.

theological.title: Psalms Chapter 98 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Psalms Chapter 98 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Psalms 98:1, which attribute of God is demonstrated by His 'right hand' and 'holy arm'?
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:1 describes God's right hand and holy arm as having obtained victory, indicating His sovereign power and triumph. This aligns with Exodus 15:6, Isaiah 41:10, Romans 8:37, and Revelation 19:11 which emphasize God's mighty power and victorious nature.

questions.question: What has the LORD made known according to Psalms 98:2?
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:2 states that the LORD has made known His salvation and openly shown His righteousness. This truth is consistent with Isaiah 12:2, John 3:17, Romans 10:13, and 2 Timothy 1:9 which teach God's revelation of salvation to mankind.

questions.question: In Psalms 98:3, what two divine attributes does God remember toward the house of Israel?
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:3 highlights God's remembrance of His mercy and truth toward Israel. This reflects God's steadfast love and faithfulness found also in Exodus 34:6, Lamentations 3:22-23, Hebrews 6:13-18, and 1 John 1:9.

questions.question: What is the response called for in Psalms 98:4 from all the earth?
options: Make a joyful noise, rejoice, and sing praise
questions.correctAnswer: Make a joyful noise, rejoice, and sing praise
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:4 commands all the earth to make a joyful noise, rejoice, and sing praise to the LORD, reflecting worship and celebration. Similar calls appear in Psalms 100:1-2, Isaiah 12:5, Hebrews 13:15, and Revelation 19:7.

questions.question: Which instruments are mentioned in Psalms 98:5 as means to sing unto the LORD?
options: Harp and the voice of a psalm
questions.correctAnswer: Harp and the voice of a psalm
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:5 specifies singing unto the LORD with the harp and the voice of a psalm, emphasizing musical worship. This corresponds with 1 Chronicles 15:16, Psalms 33:2, Ephesians 5:19, and Colossians 3:16 which encourage musical praise.

questions.question: According to Psalms 98:6, what instruments should make a joyful noise before the LORD, the King?
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:6 calls for trumpets and the sound of cornet to make a joyful noise before the LORD, signifying His kingship and majesty. This is consistent with Numbers 10:2, Joshua 6:20, 2 Chronicles 5:12-13, and Revelation 11:15 which use trumpets in divine worship and proclamation.

questions.question: What natural elements are personified as praising God in Psalms 98:7?
options: The sea and the fullness thereof
questions.correctAnswer: The sea and the fullness thereof
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:7 personifies the sea and its fullness as roaring in praise to God, illustrating all creation worshiping Him. Similar imagery is found in Psalms 65:13, Psalms 148:7-10, Job 38:8-11, and Romans 8:19-22.

questions.question: In Psalms 98:8, what do the floods and hills do in response to the LORD?
options: Floods clap their hands and hills be joyful together
Floods are still and hills are silent
Floods flow and hills stand firm
questions.correctAnswer: Floods clap their hands and hills be joyful together
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:8 depicts the floods clapping their hands and hills rejoicing, symbolizing creation's joyful response to God. This poetic expression is echoed in Isaiah 55:12, Psalms 96:11-12, Habakkuk 3:19, and Revelation 19:6.

questions.question: What is the reason given in Psalms 98:9 for creation’s joyful praise?
options: Because the LORD is coming to judge the earth with righteousness and equity
Because the LORD created the heavens and the earth
Because the LORD gave the law to Israel
Because the LORD is merciful and slow to anger
questions.correctAnswer: Because the LORD is coming to judge the earth with righteousness and equity
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:9 explains that the LORD comes to judge the earth with righteousness and equity, which prompts creation’s joy. This eschatological theme aligns with Ecclesiastes 12:14, Acts 17:31, Romans 2:5-11, and Revelation 20:11-13.

questions.question: Which theme is central in Psalms 98 regarding God's interaction with the world?
questions.explanation: Psalms 98 emphasizes God’s salvation made known to all and His righteous judgment of the earth, reflecting His justice and mercy. Supporting Scripture includes Isaiah 42:1-4, John 5:22, Romans 3:25-26, and 2 Corinthians 5:21.

questions.question: How does Psalms 98 portray the universality of God's salvation?
options: All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God
Salvation is hidden from the nations
Salvation is reserved for the righteous only
questions.correctAnswer: All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:3 states that all the ends of the earth have seen God’s salvation, highlighting the global scope of His redemptive work. This is consistent with Genesis 12:3, Isaiah 49:6, Matthew 28:19, and Acts 10:34-35.

questions.question: Which attributes of God are particularly emphasized in Psalms 98 in relation to His coming judgment?
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:9 highlights that God judges the earth with righteousness and equity, affirming His just and fair nature. This is supported by Deuteronomy 32:4, Psalm 89:14, Romans 2:11, and Revelation 15:3.

questions.question: What type of new song does Psalms 98:1 command believers to sing to the LORD?
options: A new song for His marvelous works
questions.correctAnswer: A new song for His marvelous works
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:1 calls for a new song to the LORD because He has done marvelous things. This reflects renewal and praise for God’s ongoing acts, as seen also in Psalms 96:1, Isaiah 42:10, Revelation 5:9, and Ephesians 5:19.

questions.question: How does Psalms 98 describe the role of music and instruments in worship?
options: Music and instruments are used to make a joyful noise before the LORD
Music and instruments are forbidden in worship
Worship must be done without instruments
questions.correctAnswer: Music and instruments are used to make a joyful noise before the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:4-6 encourages the use of musical instruments like harp, trumpet, and cornet to joyfully praise God, a practice supported in 1 Chronicles 16:23-25, Psalms 150, Colossians 3:16, and James 5:13.

questions.question: What eschatological event is referenced in Psalms 98:9?
options: The LORD coming to judge the earth
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD coming to judge the earth
questions.explanation: Psalms 98:9 speaks of the LORD’s coming to judge the earth, reflecting the final judgment theme found throughout Scripture, such as in Daniel 7:13-14, Matthew 25:31-46, Acts 17:31, and Revelation 20:11-15.
